item.title: 14 selling drugs | 13th May 2025
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On May 13th, 2025, at approximately 05:01, the resident of Flat Number 14 was observed violating his conditional order by...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On May 13th, 2025, at approximately 05:01, the resident of Flat Number 14 was observed violating his conditional order by pacing outside Flat 15’s door, a behavior noted to occur daily. During this time, a suspected drug transaction took place in plain view of the front door camera. An individual on a pushbike approached, exchanged money for a small packet containing a white substance with the resident, who then returned inside. Previous observations and reports indicate ongoing drug-related activity at Flat 14, including suspicious visitors, disturbances, and direct witnessing of similar transactions.

Reported To:
WDH (now vico homes) | The Police | Logged on this CMS

Details:
On May 13th, 2025, at approximately 05:01, the resident of Flat Number 14 was observed exiting his flat, immediately walking and loitering in front of Flat Number 15.
This is in violation of his conditional order yet is quickly becoming a more frequent daily occurrence.
The resident was seen pacing for approximately three minutes outside Flat 15.
During this time, a suspected drug transaction was captured on the front door camera.
An individual wearing either a balaclava or a black cap and hoodie arrived on a pushbike.
The resident of Flat 14 retrieved a small packet containing a white substance from his pocket and held it while the individual on the bicycle produced money.
The two then exchanged items: the resident handed over the packet and accepted the cash before returning inside.

Additional Context:
* There have been ongoing concerns regarding suspected drug activity at Flat 14 for years now.
* The resident has been overheard, through the bathroom ceiling, speaking on the phone about selling cocaine and storing proceeds in a digital account called “nest”.
* Individuals with suspicious behavior have previously approached us, inquiring about the resident of number 14 and expressing a need to “get some stuff.”
* There have been multiple incidents of disturbances, including a anorexic woman in distress shouting and banging at Flat 14’s door, reportedly due to an inability to purchase substances.
* Both us and other neighbors have witnessed suspected drug transactions at Flat 14’s door on several occasions.

Video:
The first three minutes of the resident’s pacing have been condensed in the attached video for brevity.
The footage then slows to normal speed to clearly show the arrival of the individual on the pushbike and the subsequent exchange.
This incident is consistent with an ongoing pattern of suspected drug-related activity and repeated breaches of the resident’s conditional order.

item.title: taking pictures, stalking | 6th November 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On November 6th, 2024, between 01:35PM and 01:00AM the next day, multiple suspicious activities involving the resident of no#14...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:

On November 6th, 2024, between 01:35PM and 01:00AM the next day, multiple suspicious activities involving the resident of no#14 were observed:
* At 01:35: no#14 appeared to be recording/photographing us as we left for shopping.
* Shortly after: no#14 was outside, walking towards our bins, then our front door.
* At 14:00: no#14 walked past tour window, observing it and the camera.
* At 20:00: Similar behaviour was noted, with only snapshots captured.
* At 01:00 (Nov 7th): no#14 walked his dog in front of our door, but no footage was recorded due to low light.

The incident has been reported to the police via 101 as advised by WDH Sam Palmer.

Reported To:
Logged on this CMS | WDH  | The Police via 101

Details:
On November 6th, 2024, at approximately 01:35, we left to go shopping, we noticed the resident of no#14 standing at his window.
The individual appeared to be holding a phone in a manner suggesting he was recording or photographing us. Upon noticing that he had been seen, the resident of no#14 quickly ducked out of view.
Approximately two minutes after we had left, the resident of #14 was observed walking outside our flat.
He briefly returned before re-emerging, at which point he walked towards our bins aswell as fixating on our front door.
Further observations were made throughout the day:
*At 14:00, the resident of #14 was seen walking past the front room window of our flat, looking at both the windows and our camera.
*A similar observation was made at 20:00 as the resident was leaving his property. Only snapshots of this event were captured by the camera.
*At approximately 01:00 on the 7th, the resident of no#14 returned and took his dog out in front of our door camera. Due to low light conditions, the motion detector did not activate, and no footage was recorded.
*Action Taken:
As advised by WDH Sam Palmer, this incident has been reported to the police for further investigation and documentation.

Video:

item.title: Police Statement | 14th October 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Statement: Press Play to read aloud: ﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ in the above-named person making a statement in relation to multiple...
item.content:encoded:
Statement:
  Press Play to read aloud:   

in the above-named person making a statement in relation to multiple reports I made to the police regarding my neighbour harassing me and my partner.
The harassment has also involved an assault, criminal damage and theft.
The neighbour in question is a male, I believe to be Nathaniel Beech who lives in the flat above me.
Me and my partner moved into our bottom floor flat in November 2022 in which everything was fine for a couple of months.

In January 2023 Nathaniel who lives above us started playing music really loud on the night time, this was in the early hours of the morning, mainly on weekends.
In April 2023 we decided to address the problem as it was not stopping, in which we wrote a letter politely after we could stop playing music loud after midnight.
We tried knocking to hand this to him in person, but him and his friends stood at the window laughing at us therefore, I just posted this through this letter box.
I have a copy of this letter I posted in which I will exhibit it as LCT 1.
Nothing changed after his letters were posted, If anything, things got worse.
Due to this I made a complaint to the council in May 2023 in which they said they would send a noise warning letter to him.
The council has even been out to speak to him, in which he has avoided them and run away.
Nathaniel still insisted on playing loud music on a weekend
LCT 1

On the 23rd of June 2023 we were woken up by Nathaniel, playing extremely loud music in the early hours of the morning.
My partner banged on the ceiling to get his attention to turn the music down in which Nathaniel just banged back so we did this again.
Nathaniel has then run downstairs and started punching at our front door and threatening us as well, telling us to come outside as he was going to bray us.
He was very aggressive and angry.
He then grabbed one of our outdoor furniture chairs and tried to use this to push our front door, in which he broke our chair.
He then grabbed our second chair and threw that at our door causing this chair to also break these chairs both belong to me, I bought them and I’m the owner of them.
He had no right or authority to break these chairs.
I took pictures of the damage he has caused and I will exhibit these as LCT 2.
We stayed inside during this incident in which, after around 10 to 15 minutes, Nathaniel returned upstairs.
LCT 2

On the 14th of August 2023 Nathaniel had thrown eggs at our front window, me and my partner was inside our property.
We heard Nathaniel running downstairs.
He then threw a pack of a dozen eggs at our front window.
We were sitting in our front room to witness him do this and then run off down the street.
We then contacted one from the antisocial department room Wakefield Council, in which they came out and said that they were going to write to Nathaniel about this.
I was disappointed in this response, as I was told not to talk to the police for which, looking back at wish I did, I have had to spend my time cleaning our window to get all of the eggs off.

On the 25th of September 2023 Nathaniel assaulted my partner and tried to break into our flat, at around 8 pm. My partner and I were inside our flat and I heard a big bang.
My partner said if he needed a cigarette and he would go and have a look to see what the noise was.
We then found a pot that we had put outside to feed the animals had been thrown.
This was not damaged, but all the animal food had come out of it, showing that it had been thrown, there was also a lot of quick grass that had been thrown at our door, causing a mess to be outside of our front door.
We then brushed it away, in which we saw Nathaniel stood at his window watching us.
He then came running down and outside.
He was being aggressive shouting “what the fuck are you doing”.
I told him I was going to ring the police to which he responded with “I do not care”
Nathaniel then punched my partner on the side of the face in which he was concussed and had a significant burse to the side.
Nathaniel dragged my partner to the grass pavement and got him to the floor, he was using his hands and tried to stick his fingers into his eyes.
I called the police and attempted to get Nathaniel off my partner by pulling his boxer pants.
My partner managed to get free, in which we both ran into our flat, Nathaniel followed us and attempted to force his way into our flat.
He was pushing the door open, even when we walked away from the door, he attempts to enter.
He managed to open our door slightly, but police arrived and arrested him for assaulting my partner, in which my partner provided a statement for this.
I have CCTV of Nathaniel trying to gain access to our flat which
I will exhibit as LCT 3.
I also have photos of my partner’s injuries, which I will exhibit as LCT 4.
I believe there was no further action from this incident
LCT 3   LCT 4

on the 18th of December 2023 around half two in the morning, Nathaniel came running downstairs banging on our front door, shouting Shut the fuck up, in which we were both asleep until this awoke me.
He then egged the front door, front window, bathroom window and kitchen window, we were unsure why he did this as we made no noise at all, our CCTV footage of this from within our flat in which he can be heard,
I will exhibit this as LCT 5.
I got back in touch with the council which they informed me that our case was closed as they could not get in touch with him.
From this third report, our case got reopened.
LCT 5

On the 10th of January 2024, my partner and I went out for my birthday.
We saw Nathaniel at his window as we left in a taxi.
We returned home at around 10 p.m. in which we saw lots of smashed glass on the floor and noticed the glass panel in our front door had been smashed.
I called my mum for advice on how to report this and how to get my door fixed.
We had a letterbox camera which has audio and voices can be heard in this before a smash is heard.
I will exhibit this audio footage, as LCT 6.
I have also taken photos of the damage caused which I will exhibit as LCT 7.
The police did not have enough evidence to arrest him, in which there was no further action on this case.
LCT 6  LCT 7

on the 9th of March 2024 at 4:14AM, Nathaniel was videoing through our letterbox.
We had our letterbox moving, which I checked our camera which is when I’ve seen Nathaniel.
when looking he has had his phone in front of him looking at our door.
By the time I checked the cameras, he was gone.
Nathaniel returned at 6:10AM, in which he did the same thing.
This time he had his flashlight on his phone showing he was filming.
I had this on CCTV, which I will exhibit as LCT 8.
I rang the council about this straight away after the incident in which they told me I had to ring the police, and when I called the police, they set me up an appointment in which an officer was sent the following day to establish whether or not this could be a Burglary or not.
An officer attended, which is when the harassment was logged.
LCT 8

On the 1st of April 2024 our drain pipe was pulled out.
Our drainpipe was located at the side of our property so our CCTV does not cover the damage taken place. However, it can be seen going past our front door towards the side of our flat, a large bang is heard and then he returned, and you can hear him go back upstairs.
I will exhibit the CCTV footage as LCT 9.
I also took photos of the damage which I will exhibit as LCT 10.
We noticed a damage the following day, in which this is when we reported it to the Council and police, in which this added to our ongoing harassment case.
LCT 9  LCT 10

On the 26th of April 2024 we had a big bang at half five In the morning.
We looked on our camera and we could see Nathaniel outside our front door.
He was moving our outside chair around,
spitting at our door and sticking his finger up at our camera in our window.
He also broke our bird feeder before walking off of this.
We later found this in our brown bin, it was trashed and not reusable.
I have CCTV footage of this which I will exhibit as LCT 11
LCT 11

On the 12th of May 2024 Nathaniel was with a friend at approximately 9:50pm.
The friend he was with tried out our door handle.
My partner shouted, asking what he was doing in which he could then be seen leaving and heard going upstairs in the final shot.
I’m unsure of the details for his friend and because of this, I did not report this to the police.
I will exhibit the CCTV as LCT 12.
LCT 12

On the 8th of June 2024 Nathaniel punched the outside light, no damage was caused. At around 1:30AM I was watching through our camera and I could see Nathaniel walking past our door various times recording on his phone.
Nathaniel then punched our outdoor light before turning back to his flat
I Have CCTV of this incident which I will exhibit it as LCT 13.
I called the police in which they sent someone out to have a look,
but nothing else came of this.
LCT 13

On the 15th of June 2024 Nathaniel can be seen making an aggressive hand at our camera we have sat up at the window.
This was ‘sticking one up’ at it, I will exabit this footage as LCT 14.
LCT 14

On the 16th of August 2024 Nathaniel smashed our animal water tub.
He could be seen walking his dog outside our house and he then throws an object at our front door before coming close to our door.
He then kicked our water tub that we had outside for the animals, causing it to brake.
I have CCTV footage of this which I exhibit as LCT 15.
I also took pictures of the damage that I will exhibit as LCT 16.
I replaced this dish later on in the day in which Nathaniel returns
to also break this one.
I have this on CCTV also and will exhibit it as LCT 17 and a photo of this further damage as LCT 18.
LCT 15   LCT 16   LCT 17   LCT 18

On the 14th of September 2024 he took our outside chairs away from our property,
spat on our door and used our animal water bowl to dispose of his cigarette.
On this day he kept going in and out of his flat in which each time he’s done something different to us.
He kept looking around prior to doing something to
ensure no one else was around.
We later found out chairs at the bottom of the road.
I have CCTV covering these incidents, which are an exhibit at LCT 19.
LCT 19

On the 21st of September 2024.
He was outside our flat, taking pictures, spitting on our doors and chais, and was locking at our front door near enough all day.
It was around 11:18AM which I could see him on our cameras holding his phone up to our house, he can even be seen doing this through our bedroom window.
Later on in the day he was stood at our front door just staring at it.
I have all these instances CCTV which I will exhibit as LCT 20.
LCT 20

I do not give Nathaniel Beech the right or authority to constantly harass me and my partner, we try not to interact with him so I am not sure why he keeps persistently targeting us.
We even avoid going outside after 2PM unless we really have to as we do not want any trouble.
he has damaged property belonging to us.
He has taken our property away from us and assaulted my partner in the past which was unprovoked.
He is the only person we’ve ever had a negative interaction with.
He was fine with us the first month we moved in, but then for no reason at all, he developed a hatred towards us.
This incident is making me feel awful.
I feel like I do not have a life.
It is affecting me mentally and causing me stress which led to me being ill.
I do not understand why he would spend his time doing this to impact our lives.
All I want is for him to leave us alone.
I am willing to attend court and support prosecution in relation to this matter.

Audio:

item.title: Apprehension of Resident at no#14 | 13th October 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: on October 13, 2024, at approximately 6:13 PM, law enforcement officers made another attempt to apprehend the resident of...
item.content:encoded:
Summery: on October 13, 2024, at approximately 6:13 PM, law enforcement officers made another attempt to apprehend the resident of 14 Pine Close. Unlike previous attempts, this time they were successful. This action followed numerous unsuccessful requests for the individual to attend a voluntary appearance (VA).The resident has a documented history of non-compliance with both law enforcement and housing authorities (WDH). Summery and Details
—-On October 13, 2024, at approximately 6:13 PM, law enforcement officers made
—-another attempt to apprehend the resident of 14 Pine Close. Unlike previous
—-attempts, this time they were successful. This action followed numerous
—-unsuccessful requests for the individual to attend a voluntary appearance (VA).
—-The resident has a documented history of non-compliance with both law
—-enforcement and housing authorities (WDH).
1. Initial Observation and Notification
◦    6:02 PM (00:01 in video): The resident of no#14 was seen returning to his flat.
—-We contacted the police via 101 as previously instructed.
◦    6:14 PM (00:14): An officer knocked on our door to confirm the resident of no#14’s
—-presence. Lucy confirmed his presence, to which the officer thanked her and
—-walked away.
2. Police Arrival and Initial Attempts
◦    6:16 PM (01:24): A second officer arrived to assist in apprehending the resident.
◦    6:17 PM (01:52): An officer was seen looking up at the resident’s windows for
—-visual confirmation.
◦    6:17 PM (02:00): Officers knocked on no#14’s door.
◦    6:17 PM (02:09): Another officer was seen walking around the side of the flats.
3. Escalation of Efforts
◦    6:17 PM – 6:19 PM (02:23): Officers walked back and forth in front of the flats
—-trying to spot the resident at his windows.
◦    6:19 PM (02:46): A bang noise, presumably made by an officer, triggered the
—-resident to shout, “The fuck they doing.” Some inaudible talking followed but
—-could not be clearly recorded.
◦    6:19 PM (03:13): An officer was seen walking the perimeter of the flats.
◦    6:19 PM (03:21): Officers knocked on the door again, triggering dog barks
—-from inside.
◦    6:20 PM (03:47): An officer was seen at the front while running sounds were
—-audible from above.
4. Resident’s Evasive Behaviour
◦    6:20 PM (04:18): Running sounds were heard from inside 14 Pine Close, indicating
—-activity.
◦    6:21 PM (04:39): An officer walked down the side of the flats; shortly after, sounds
—-of items falling over were heard from above.
◦    6:21 PM (05:08): Another police car arrived to assist with apprehending the
—-resident. Officers were seen accessing their vehicle’s boot while discussing the
—-situation.
5. Conversation at our door
◦    6:26 PM – 6:27 PM (08:06 – 08:46): An officer explained they knew the resident
—-was home because they had seen him at the window.
—-They warned Lucy about a potential loud bang if they needed to force entry.
—-Lucy informed them about a dangerous dog that had previously attempted to
—-snatch an officer’s button through the letterbox.
6. Final Apprehension
◦    6:28 PM – 6:32 PM (09:29 – 12:28): Officers continued to stand outside as it got
—-darker. Another police car arrived at this time.
◦    6:29 PM (10:42): A large officer was seen shouting at the window.
◦    6:30 PM (11:00): An officer could be heard saying “Come Down.”
—-(Repeated x3 and x3 slower in video)
◦    6:32 PM (12:28): The larger officer awaited a response while sounds from above
—-indicated movement.
7. Conclusion of Incident
◦    6:36 PM (13:13): The sound of 14 Pine Close’s door closing was heard as a police
—-car approached.
◦    6:36 PM (13:50): Officers escorted the resident into a police vehicle.
◦    At approximately 15 minutes and 20 seconds in video, police cars were seen
—-driving away with the resident inside.

Video:

item.title: Evading Police continues into Third Day | 11th October2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On October 11, 2024, at approximately 11:48 AM, law enforcement officers made another attempt to apprehend the resident of...
item.content:encoded:
Summery: On October 11, 2024, at approximately 11:48 AM, law enforcement officers made another attempt to apprehend the resident of 14 Pine Close. This action followed numerous unsuccessful requests for the individual to attend a voluntary appearance (VA). The resident has a documented history of non-compliance with both law enforcement and housing authorities (WDH).Summery and Details
—-On October 11, 2024, at approximately 11:48 AM, law enforcement officers
—-made another attempt to apprehend the resident of 14 Pine Close.
—-This action followed numerous unsuccessful requests for the individual to
—-attend a voluntary appearance (VA). The resident has a documented history
—-of non-compliance with both law enforcement and housing authorities (WDH).
 1.  11:48 AM
—-Officers arrived at the location, as evidenced by photographic documentation.
 2.  11:50 AM
 —-At 11:50 AM (00:20 into the attached video), officers knocked loudly on the
—-door of 14 Pine Close. The resident ignored this attempt, despite being
—-audible inside the property shortly before and after the knocking.
 3.  Subsequent Attempts
◦    At 11:50 AM (00:42 in video), officers knocked again, followed by additional
—-knocks at 11:51 AM (01:10 and 01:44 in video).
◦    Shortly after, Lucy answered the door at 11:52 AM (02:55 in video) and spoke
—-with an officer for around 40 seconds before closing the door at 11:53 AM.
 4.  Continued Ignoring
◦    At 11:54 AM (04:08 in video), officers knocked on number 14 once more
—-but received no response.
◦    Between 11:55 AM and 11:56 AM (04:55 in video), officers were observed
—-walking around the area, looking up at the windows in an attempt to locate
—-the resident but were unsuccessful.
 5.  Further Attempts to Make Contact
◦    Officers knocked again at 11:58 AM (05:47 in video) and continued to be
—-ignored, with only an aggressive dog barking from within.
◦    Additional knocks occurred at 11:59 AM (06:10 in video) and again at 12:00 PM
—-(06:48 in video). A loud bang was heard from above during this time,
—-indicating the resident’s presence.
◦    Despite further attempts at knocking shortly thereafter
—-(12:00 PM, 07:02 in video), the officers were still ignored.
 6.  Revisiting Neighbor for Discussion
◦    At 12:02 PM (08:22 in video), officers returned to our door to discuss the
—-situation regarding number 14. During this time, they knocked again on
—-number 14 at 12:03 PM (08:46 in video) but received no response.
◦    Officers returned to speak with Lucy again at 12:03 PM (09:16 in video), where
—-they explained that due to the resident’s continued non-compliance and their
—-inability to confirm his presence, they could not enter the property.
—-They advised that we should call 101 when we are certain of his presence and
—-warn them about the aggressive dog that had previously attempted to
—-snatch an officer’s baton at the letterbox.
 7.  Conclusion of Visit
◦    The officers left at 12:05 PM (10:48 in video) and were seen driving away
—-at 12:06 PM (11:01 in video).
◦    Additional evidence includes a photo of their arrival at 11:48 AM
—-(11:22 in video) and a video from a living room window showing one officer
—-looking up at the flat windows of number 14 at 11:52 AM (11:33 in video),
—-which also displayed egg residue from prior incidents.

Video:

item.title: Evading Police again | 10th October2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On October 10, 2024, at 10:38 AM, officers attempted to apprehend a resident at 14 Pine Close following multiple...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On October 10, 2024, at 10:38 AM, officers attempted to apprehend a resident at 14 Pine Close following multiple failed requests for a voluntary appearance
— The resident had a history of non-compliance with law enforcement
——– and housing authorities
—— ◉10:39 AM: Officers knocked forcefully on the door of number 14.
——– Despite audible activity inside, there was no response
—— ◉10:40 AM: Officers knocked on our door to inquire about the resident,
——– but we had left for shopping 20 minutes earlier
——◉ 10:42 AM: After receiving no response, the officers departed.
——– As they drove away, sounds of movement were captured from
——– the upper floor of number 14

Details:
On October 10, 2024, at approximately 10:38AM, officers arrived at 14 Pine Close to attempt apprehension of the resident. This action followed multiple unsuccessful requests for the individual to attend a voluntary appearance (VA). The resident has an established history of non-compliance with both law enforcement agencies and housing authorities (WDH).
1. 10:39 AM (01:14 in attached video): Officers knocked forcefully on the door of number 14. The resident appeared to be present but non-responsive, as evidenced by audible activity within the premises both before and after the officers’ attempt to make contact.
2. 10:40 AM (02:06 in attached video): Officers proceeded to knock on our door to inquire about the resident of number 14. However we had left for a shopping approximately 20 minutes prior.
3. 10:42 AM (04:03 and 05:21 in attached video, from different camera angles): After receiving no response, the officers departed the premises. As they drove away, the video captured sounds of movement from the upper floor of number 14.

Video:

item.title: Evading Police and Emerging After They Leave | 09th October2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On October 09, 2024, police made two attempts to apprehend the resident of Flat #14 Pine Close due to...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On October 09, 2024, police made two attempts to apprehend the resident of Flat #14 Pine Close due to ongoing non-compliance with requests to attend a voluntary appearance (VA).
—1. First attempt 8:58 AM
——◉Police arrived and knocked on the resident’s door multiple times, as documented in the attached video.
——◉ Officers also spoke with Lucy about the tenant of flat no#14.
——◉ After nearly an hour of attempts, they left at approximately 9:51 AM without making contact.
—2. Second attempt 12:41 PM
——◉ Officers returned and again knocked on the door but received no response.
——◉ They consulted with Lucy once more before leaving at 12:47 PM.
—Subsequent behavior:
——◉ The resident has a history of ignoring both police and WDH requests.
——◉ Sounds were heard from within Flat #14 throughout the day,
——– indicating the resident’s presence.
——◉ The resident was observed leaving the flat 4 minutes after police departure.

Details:
On October 09, 2024, at approximately 8:57AM, officers arrived at Pine Close and made two separate attempts to apprehend the resident of Flat #14 Pine Close following numerous unsuccessful requests for the individual to attend a voluntary appearance (VA)
This was not their first attempt, this resident has a history of non-compliance with both law enforcement and housing authorities (WDH)
First Attempt – 8:58 AM
Officers arrived at the premises at 8:58 AM, as documented in the attached video at 6:52. They repeatedly knocked on the door of Flat #14, audible in the recording at 00:32 and several times thereafter.
• At 01:06, officers knocked on our door.
• At 01:45, officers spoke with Lucy, regarding the tenant of Flat #14.
• Multiple attempts were made to contact the resident of Flat #14.
• At 09:26 in the video (corresponding to 4:53 AM real-time), officers departed after nearly an hour of attempted contact.
• sounds of banging and movement were audible from within Flat #14, indicating the resident’s presence.
Second Attempt – 12:41 PM
Law enforcement returned to the location at 12:41 PM, as seen in the video at 09:36. During this attempt:
• At 10:22 in the video, officers knocked on the door of Flat #14 but received no response.
• At 12:05 in the video, officers again consulted with Lucy regarding the resident of Flat #14.
• After further unsuccessful attempts to make contact, the police left the premises at 12:47 PM, visible in the video at 15:47.
• At 03:51PM (real-time), approximately four minutes after police departure, the resident was observed leaving the flat. This is visible in the attached video at 16:57.

Video:

item.title: Evading Police Presence Then Walking Outside Shortly After Their Departure | 28th September 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On September 28, 2024, police made two attempts to conduct a Vulnerability Assessment for the resident of flat #14...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On September 28, 2024, police made two attempts to conduct a Vulnerability Assessment for the resident of flat #14 at Pine Close:
—1. First attempt 11:05 AM
——◉ Officers arrived at 11:05 AM
——◉ Officers left at 11:09 AM
——◉ Resident briefly exited with dog, then quickly returned upon seeing police
—2.Second attempt 3:49 PM:
——◉ Officers arrived at 3:49 AM
——◉ Resident seen in window but ignored officers
——◉ Police left at 3:52 PM
Subsequent behavior:
–—◉ Resident remained in flat for 6 hours with intermittent noise disturbances
—–◉ From 9:30 PM onwards, resident observed:
——◉ Walking around outside repeatedly
——◉ Looking through our window as passing at 10:32 PM
——◉ Briefly returning to flat, then continuing to walk around outside

Details:
On September 28, 2024, at approximately 11:05 AM, officers arrived at Pine Close in an attempt to conduct a Vulnerability Assessment (VA) for the resident of flat no#14. This was not their first attempt, as the resident has a history of ignoring both the police and WDH.
The officers departed at precisely 11:09 AM. Less than one minute later, the resident was observed exiting his flat with his dog.
Upon noticing a police vehicle driving down a street out of camera view, he was seen hastily returning to his flat, pulling the dog along.
At 3:49 PM, nearly five hours after the initial attempt, the police returned to make another effort to communicate with the resident of flat no#14.
This time, they waited longer than before and the officers became aware that the resident was present and deliberately ignoring them, as he was spotted in the window and overheard shouting at his dog for barking.
At 3:52 PM, after being ignored once again, the police left the premises.
Subsequently, the resident remained inside the apartment for approximately six hours, during which time intermittent stomping, banging, and shouting were heard.
from 9:30 PM, the resident of flat no#14 was observed walking around outside our flat on multiple occasions over several hours.
At 10:32 PM, he can be seen looking through our window while passing our flat.
Following this, he returned to his apartment briefly, where stomping noises were heard for a couple of minutes. He then came back outside and continued to walk around.

Video:

item.title: Taking pictures, Trying to see inside flat, spitting on chairs, cig in pet water | 21st September 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: —1. On September 21, 2024, at approximately 11:18 AM, Nathaniel Beach was seen ——walking around the property with a...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
—1. On September 21, 2024, at approximately 11:18 AM, Nathaniel Beach was seen
——walking around the property with a mobile device, potentially recording or
——viewing the interior of the reporter’s flat.
—2. He was observed at the reporter’s front door, seemingly recording the entryway.
—3. Later in the evening, he engaged in more concerning behavior:
——◉ Standing at the front door and checking for witnesses
——◉ Spitting on chairs near the property
——◉ Pacing outside and looking at the camera
——◉ Deliberately placing a cigarette end in an outdoor pet water bowl
—1. His actions appeared calculated, including retreating backwards while
——maintaining eye contact with the door, as if waiting for a reaction.
—2. Incidents from 6:30 PM onwards were reported to the police via their online chat
——system due to high call volumes.
—3. A police appointment is scheduled for Sunday at 10 PM, and the matter will be
——further reported to WDH on Monday.

Reported To:
Logged on this CMS | WDH  | The Police via 101

Details:
On Saturday, September 21, 2024, at approximately 11:18 AM, the resident of flat number 14, Mr. Nathaniel Beach, was observed via surveillance cameras once again engaging in suspicious behavior around our property.
The individual was seen holding a mobile device while walking around outside our flat.
He briefly moved out of camera range for approximately 30 seconds before returning to his flat.
11:32 AM: Our living room camera captured him outside our property, holding his phone in a manner suggesting he was recording or attempting to view the interior of our bedroom and living room windows.
11:33 AM: he was observed at our front door (One minute later).
His actions, including moving his phone up and down while looking around, indicated he was more than likley recording our entryway.
He then returned to his flat.
6:30 PM: he was observed standing at our front door, staring, then moving towards the bin area before returning. His behavior suggested he was checking for witnesses.
7:05 PM: he left his residence, heading towards the park up the hill.
7:30 PM: Upon returning, he crossed the grass towards our bins, paused, then approached the chairs, spat on them, and proceeded to his flat.
10:21 PM: he was then seen pacing outside.
10:22 PM: He walked past the window, looking at the camera while smoking.
10:24 PM: he then passed by again, moving towards the front of the property.
10:25 PM: he approached our front door and stood staring for several seconds. He attempted to discard his cigarette in our outdoor pet water bowl, initially missing. He then bent down, retrieved the cigarette end, and deliberately placed it in the water.
He retreated backwards, maintaining his gaze on the door, seemingly waiting for a reaction. After pausing at a distance, he moved towards our bins before returning to his flat.
All incidents from 6:30 PM onwards have been reported to the police via their online chat system, as advised due to high call volumes. The report has been forwarded to PC O’Neil.
This matter will be further reported to WDH on Monday, following the scheduled police appointment on Sunday at 10 PM.

Video:

item.title: Taking chairs to throw into street, Spitting on door & throwing tab end in animal water bowl | 14th September 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On September 14, 2024, at approximately 07:15, the resident of 14 Pine Close once again engaged in a series...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On September 14, 2024, at approximately 07:15, the resident of 14 Pine Close once again engaged in a series of disruptive and concerning behaviors:

  1. Early morning disturbance: Shouting at 4 AM, presumably on the phone.
    likely unable to order his cocaine for the day, (usually the reason for his shouting)
  2. Suspicious activity, property damage and theft (around 7:15 AM):
    • Paced around front of our door while smoking
    • Discarded cigarette in pet water bowl
    • Repeatedly entered and exited his flat, surveying the area
    • Brought out his dog briefly
    • Spat on our door again
    • Took our chairs and walked towards the road
    • Quickly returned to his flat, passing a man walking a dog

This event are part of ongoing issues with this neighbor, indicating a pattern of problematic behavior.

Reported To:
Logged on this CMS | WDH  | The Police via 101

Details:
On September 14, 2024, at approximately 07:15 the resident of 14 Pine Close exhibited disruptive behavior yet again, including prolonged periods of walking around and shouting, presumably on the phone, at 4 AM. The situation escalated when the individual spat on our door, disposed of a half smoked cig in our pet water bowl turning it yellow, and removed our chairs, leaving them down the road. This incident has been reported to the police via 101, PC Daniel O’Neil via email, and Sam Palmer, our council representative, through One Call, who has been updated on the ongoing issues.

At approximately 7:15 AM, the neighbor emerged from his residence, smoking a cigarette while pacing in front of our door area. After two minutes of this behavior, he positioned himself near our outdoor chairs, which we use as a bird table due to a previous incident where he attempted to break in by smashing them against our door. He partially finished his cigarette and discarded it into the pet water bowl turning it yellow before returning to his flat.

Fifteen minutes later, the individual reappeared, briefly surveying the area before retreating to retrieve his dog. He then stood on the grass with the dog while continuing to look around, only to return the dog to his flat after a short period. Two minutes later, he reemerged, fixating on our door and chairs, he spat at our front door again, and walked past. He was then observed moving slowly across the area, seemingly checking for witnesses. He approached our chairs, stared at them, looked around once more, and proceeded to take them, walking towards the road. Finally, he hurriedly returned to his flat, walking past a man from over the road with his dog, Sid, in the process. (seen in at end of the longer uncut video).

Video (cut version): 3 Minutes, 50 Seconds long, coped main parts

Video (uncut version): 22 Minutes, 32 Seconds long
